intro: Vernonanthura pseudolinearifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved vernonanthura, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
